workflow_description: Launch website, find Login, Signup/GetStarted, Try for Free etc any 5 buttons and 2 links, 2 menu bar with out clicking any one of them
master_plan:
# Master Test Strategy: Adobe I/O Website - Smoke Testing

This document outlines the master test strategy for smoke testing the Adobe I/O website (https://adobe.io). It serves as a blueprint for the engineering team, ensuring a consistent and effective approach to quality assurance.

## 1. 🔍 RISK ASSESSMENT & PLANNING

*   **Domain Analysis:** Adobe I/O is a developer-focused platform. Failure to access or navigate critical sections of the website can hinder developer adoption and integration, impacting Adobe's ecosystem.
*   **Risk Profile:**
    *   **Medium:** Website unavailability or broken navigation can lead to developer frustration and delayed project timelines.
    *   **Low:** Direct financial loss is unlikely from a simple website outage, but reputational damage and loss of potential integrations are possible.
*   **Testing Scope:**
    *   **In Scope:**
        *   Website launch and basic page rendering.
        *   Identification of key elements (Login, Signup/Get Started, Try for Free, 5 buttons, 2 links, 2 menu bars).
        *   Verification of element presence and basic accessibility (no broken links).
    *   **Out of Scope:**
        *   Detailed functionality of each button/link/menu item.
        *   Negative testing (e.g., invalid login attempts).
        *   Performance testing.
        *   Cross-browser compatibility (initially, focus on a primary browser like Chrome).
        *   Mobile responsiveness.

## 2. 🏗️ TESTING STRATEGY (The "How")

This smoke test strategy focuses on verifying the basic health and accessibility of the Adobe I/O website.

*   **Smoke Suite (Sanity):**
    1.  **Website Launch:** Verify the website loads successfully (HTTP 200 OK).
    2.  **Element Identification:** Verify the presence of the following elements:
        *   Login button/link
        *   Signup/Get Started button/link
        *   Try for Free button/link
        *   5 additional buttons (any on the homepage)
        *   2 links (any on the homepage)
        *   2 menu bars (typically at the top)

*   **Regression Suite:** N/A - This is a smoke test strategy. Regression testing will be defined separately.

*   **Data Strategy:**
    *   **Static:** No specific test data is required for this smoke test. The focus is on element presence, not data input.

## 3. 🏛️ ARCHITECTURE GUIDANCE (For the Test Architect)

This section provides architectural guidance for building a robust and maintainable test automation framework.

*   **Framework Recommendation:**
    *   **Page Object Model (POM):** Implement a POM structure to represent each page of the Adobe I/O website as a separate class. This promotes code reusability and maintainability.
    *   **Example:**
        *   `HomePage.java`: Contains locators and methods for interacting with elements on the homepage (buttons, links, menu bars).
        *   `LoginPage.java`: (If applicable) Contains locators and methods for the login page.
*   **Resilience Strategy:**
    *   **Polling Assertions:** Use polling assertions (e.g., with Selenium's `WebDriverWait`) to handle potential timing issues when elements are loading. This reduces flakiness.
    *   **Example:** Wait for the "Login" button to be present before attempting to interact with it.
    *   **Self-Healing (Optional):** Explore self-healing capabilities (e.g., using AI-powered tools) to automatically update locators if they change. This is a more advanced technique and can be considered for future enhancements.

## 4. ⚔️ EXECUTION & MINING INSTRUCTIONS (For the Senior QA)

This section provides specific instructions for executing the smoke tests and identifying potential issues.

*   **Mining Targets:**
    1.  **Homepage (https://adobe.io):** This is the primary target for verifying the presence of key elements.
*   **Verification Criteria:**
    *   **Website Launch:**
        *   HTTP Status Code: 200 OK
        *   Page Title: Contains "Adobe I/O" or a relevant title.
    *   **Element Identification:**
        *   Element Presence: Verify that each of the required elements (Login, Signup, Try for Free, 5 buttons, 2 links, 2 menu bars) is present on the page using appropriate locators (e.g., XPath, CSS selectors).
        *   Element Visibility: Verify that each element is visible on the page.
*   **Reporting:**
    *   Generate a clear and concise report indicating whether each test case passed or failed.
    *   Include screenshots for any failed test cases to aid in debugging.

This Master Test Strategy provides a solid foundation for smoke testing the Adobe I/O website. It will be reviewed and updated as needed to ensure its continued effectiveness.
